parentContact Expression (context-dependent)   Specify the contact which would become the "parent" of the returned contact from this picker. If none is specified, then it is set to null by default. The main purpose of the parentContact is for passing down to the menu item set as mentioned below 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
searchLocation Expression (Location)   Overrides the location of the search page. 
setter String   Prohibit the usage of setter because ClaimContactWidget requires the setting of value via "value" not "setter" 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
showSearchInMenu Boolean true  If false, hide the AddressBook search menu item. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueRange Expression (context-dependent)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible values for this element. Should evaluate to a List or an array of Contacts. Example: valueRange="claim.getRelatedContacts(entity.Company)" 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
ClaimPickerCell top
Child elements: ColumnHeader StandardMenuElement ColumnFooter Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
clearEnabled Boolean true  Whether the user should be allowed to clear the selected value. If "true", an icon will be available which, when clicked, will clear the widget. 
colspan Integer   Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (context-dependent)   An optional expression, if sepcified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
freeInputEnabled Boolean true  If true, the user may enter a free-text value. 
hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (context-dependent)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onChange Expression (void)   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
pickLocation Expression (Object)   The Location to use for user search criteria input, as a Gosu expression of the form "[popup name].push()". 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer   The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
updatefooterSumOnCellChange Boolean true  If true, the footer sum value of this column will be updated upon each cell value change. Default to true. Only applicable when the "footerSumValue" expression is identical to the "value" expression. You can set this flag to false to reduce server load and only calculate the updated sum value when the user clicks the "Get Sum" button or refreshes the page. 
useHeaderStyle Boolean false  If true, renders this cell in header style. Defaults to false. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
value Expression (Object)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell, either in pixels ("30") or percentage ("30%"). Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. This attribute does not affect size of the Textbox or Dropdwon when editing the field. Instead you can use "numCols" on TextCell to specify the size of the Textbox; or "valueWidth" on TypeKeyCell/RangeCell to specify the pixel width of the Dropdown. 
wrap Boolean true  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to true. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  If true, allows the "label" to wrap. Defaults to false. The value of wrapLabel may be ignored if enableSort is set to true. 
ClaimPickerInput top
Child elements: StandardMenuElement Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
clearEnabled Boolean true  Whether the user should be allowed to clear the selected value. If "true", an icon will be available which, when clicked, will clear the widget. This attribute is ignored if freeInputEnabled is not set to "true". 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
freeInputEnabled Boolean true  If true, the user may enter a free-text value. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onChange statement   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
pickLocation Expression (context-dependent)   The Location to use for user search criteria input, as a Gosu expression of the form "[popup name].push()". 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
ClaimRelatedContactCell top
A ListView cell specialized for ClaimRelatedContact value.
Child elements: ColumnHeader StandardMenuElement ColumnFooter Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
claim Expression (Claim)   The Claim that is associated with this contact. This value is being passed to the ClaimContactDetailPopup() page for viewing the contact detail. Note: This field is required because ClaimContactDetailPopup() is expecting an non-null claim value. 
colspan Integer   Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (context-dependent)   An optional expression, if sepcified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
forceContactSubtype Expression (context-dependent)   Forces the "type" of this Contact column to be that specified by the expression (default gosu). If unspecified, the "type" of this Contact column is determined by the type of the value expression. Note that one can coerce the type of the value expression statically by casting it, as in "Foo.Contact as Person". Therefore, this attribute is really only useful when you want to force to a type that's determined dynamically. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (context-dependent)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
newContactMenu Expression (context-dependent)   The ID of a MenuItemSet pcf file that will be included in the picker menu. This MenuItemSet pcf file contains a MenuItem for which you want to create new contacts. The default "ClaimNewContactPickerMenuItemSet" contains all subtypes of entity.Contact. To hide the NewContact menu completely set newContactMenu="BlankNewContactPickerMenuItemSet()". Available alternative is the ClaimNewPersonOnlyPickerMenuItemSet. It can also be a custom MenuItemSet pcf file. The default prototype of a newContactMenu menu item set is the following: SOME_MENUITEMSET(requiredContactType : Type, parentContact : Contact, claim : Claim) If the menu item set is given without any parameter list (e.g. newContactMenu="ClaimNewPersonOnlyPickerMenuItemSet"), then the values obtained (or defaulted) from forceContactSubtype and parentContact are passed to the menu item set as the first and second params. The third param is obtained from the required attribute "claim" specified below. If the menu item set contains a parameter list (e.g. newContactMenu="SomeOtherPickerMenuItemSet(entity.Company, claim, claim.ClaimNumber)"), then the specified parameter list will be passed down to the menu item set 
numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onChange Expression (void)   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
parentContact Expression (context-dependent)   Specify the contact which would become the "parent" of the returned contact from this picker. If none is specified, then it is set to null by default. The main purpose of the parentContact is for passing down to the menu item set as mentioned below 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
searchLocation Expression (Location)   Overrides the location of the search page. 
setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
showNoneSelected Boolean true  If true, show the "none selected" option 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer   The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
sortValueRange Boolean true  If true, attempts to sort the results of valueRange 
styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
updatefooterSumOnCellChange Boolean true  If true, the footer sum value of this column will be updated upon each cell value change. Default to true. Only applicable when the "footerSumValue" expression is identical to the "value" expression. You can set this flag to false to reduce server load and only calculate the updated sum value when the user clicks the "Get Sum" button or refreshes the page. 
useHeaderStyle Boolean false  If true, renders this cell in header style. Defaults to false. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
value Expression (Object)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueRange Expression (context-dependent)   Gosu expression defining the range of possible values for this element. Should evaluate to a List or an array 
valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell, either in pixels ("30") or percentage ("30%"). Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. This attribute does not affect size of the Textbox or Dropdwon when editing the field. Instead you can use "numCols" on TextCell to specify the size of the Textbox; or "valueWidth" on TypeKeyCell/RangeCell to specify the pixel width of the Dropdown. 
wrap Boolean true  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to true. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  If true, allows the "label" to wrap. Defaults to false. The value of wrapLabel may be ignored if enableSort is set to true. 
Code top
A Gosu code block that can be embedded in a PCF file. It's usefully for UI data-manipulation or navigation logic that is only applicable to this particular PCF file. Do NOT put logic that is sharable by multiple PCF files or belongs to DM layer here. Any modifications to the code block content will not be upgraded. Use with caution.
No attributes
ColumnFacetType top
Base type for elements that contain a single cell
Subclasses: ColumnFooter ColumnHeader
ColumnFooter top
Renders its content as the footer cell of this column. Do NOT this to generate footer cell which contains simple readonly content, which can be handled by the "footerLabel" attribute of the Cell. This element is only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator.
Child elements: AbstractCell
No attributes
ColumnHeader top
Renders its content as the header cell of this column. Do NOT use this to generate header cell which contains simple readonly content, which can be handled by the "label" attribute of the Cell. This element is only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator.
Child elements: AbstractCell
No attributes
ConfirmPasswordInput top
An Input that displays the field as an obscured password, and has an additional "confirm" input
Child elements: StandardMenuElement Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
autoComplete Expression (AutocompleteHandler)   An optional expression that returns auto complete suggestions for this widget. USE WITH CAUTION: If specified, the expression will be evaluated at server side on each user key stroke. The value entered by the user is exposed as "VALUE". The return type must be "String[]". 
autoCompleteArgIds String   An optional attribute to specify additional arguments to pass to the "autoComplete" handler, if exists. (You don't need to specify the id of this widget as part of this attribute, because the value of this widget is passed to the handler by default; If the id of this widget is specified, the argument value passed to the handler will be null, since the value of this widget has not been fully specified when the handler is invoked.) Refers to the "id" attribute of other value widget on page. Multiple ids can be separated by ",". If specified, the latest value of these widgets will be passed to the autoComplete handler when retrieving auto complete info. 
autoCompleteTriggerChars Integer   If specified, delays autocomplete functionality until the user has entered the specified number of characters. 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
checkSpelling Boolean false  If true, enables spelling check for this cell, when the spelling check feature is enabled globally. 
confirmLabel Expression (Object)   Gosu expression for the label of the additional confirm input 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
format Expression (String)   An optional expression that returns a format pattern, which must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. When the underlying data type is not a Number, only the prefix and suffix of the pattern will be applied. For example, "#.#%" formats the Number value as percentage with up to 1 decimal digit. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
inputMask Expression (String)   A gosu expression that returns a string to use as the input mask. If not specified, the input mask (if any) specified on the value's field validator will be used. This field should only be necessary in cases where the data type has no mask or where the mask needs to be conditional. The input mask returned should be of the same format as a mask specified using the input-mask attribute on a field validator (use # for wildcards). The default placeholder specified by the InputMaskPlaceholderCharacter parameter will be used as the placeholder character during rendering. The input mask is recalculated on every render, which means that if the mask is conditional and dependent on other data on this page that it can change from one request to the next. 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
maxChars Integer 0  The maximum number of characters allowed for an input field. 
numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
oldPasswordLabel Expression (Object)   If 'requireOldPassword' is true, then this will be used as the label for the old password input. 
onChange statement   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
passwordValidationExpression Expression (Object)   Validation expression that is run on the new password before it is hashed. 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
requireOldPassword Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, requires the user to correctly enter their old password before their password can be changed. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
ContentCell top
A ListView cell containing arbitrary content, such as links.
Child elements: ColumnHeader AbstractLink ColumnFooter Reflect DetailViewPanel
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer   Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (context-dependent)   An optional expression, if sepcified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (context-dependent)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer   The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
updatefooterSumOnCellChange Boolean true  If true, the footer sum value of this column will be updated upon each cell value change. Default to true. Only applicable when the "footerSumValue" expression is identical to the "value" expression. You can set this flag to false to reduce server load and only calculate the updated sum value when the user clicks the "Get Sum" button or refreshes the page. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell, either in pixels ("30") or percentage ("30%"). Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. This attribute does not affect size of the Textbox or Dropdwon when editing the field. Instead you can use "numCols" on TextCell to specify the size of the Textbox; or "valueWidth" on TypeKeyCell/RangeCell to specify the pixel width of the Dropdown. 
wrap Boolean true  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to true. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  If true, allows the "label" to wrap. Defaults to false. 
ContentInput top
A DetailView field containing arbitrary content, such as links.
Child elements: AbstractLink
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
CurrencyCell top
Base type for all Cells that can be bound to a value.
Child elements: ColumnHeader StandardMenuElement ColumnFooter Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
colspan Integer   Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header 
exchangeRate Expression (Double)   An optional expression to return a number. If specified, the return value will be used to override the default exchange rate when calculating amount for the secondary MoneyComponent. Only meaningful, when the underlying MoneyComponent is linked to a secondary MoneyComponent with a different currency.

Normally, you do NOT want to specify this attribute, thus allow the widget to look up the proper exchange rate from the primary currency to the secondary currency. Use with caution. 

flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
footerSumFormat Expression (context-dependent)   An optional expression, if sepcified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
footerSumValue Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
icon Expression (context-dependent)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
maxChars Integer 0  The maximum number of characters allowed for an input field. 
numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onChange Expression (void)   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
sortOrder Integer   The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
updatefooterSumOnCellChange Boolean true  If true, the footer sum value of this column will be updated upon each cell value change. Default to true. Only applicable when the "footerSumValue" expression is identical to the "value" expression. You can set this flag to false to reduce server load and only calculate the updated sum value when the user clicks the "Get Sum" button or refreshes the page. 
useHeaderStyle Boolean false  If true, renders this cell in header style. Defaults to false. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
value Expression (Object)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
width String   The HTML width of the cell, either in pixels ("30") or percentage ("30%"). Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. This attribute does not affect size of the Textbox or Dropdwon when editing the field. Instead you can use "numCols" on TextCell to specify the size of the Textbox; or "valueWidth" on TypeKeyCell/RangeCell to specify the pixel width of the Dropdown. 
wrap Boolean true  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to true. 
wrapLabel Boolean false  If true, allows the "label" to wrap. Defaults to false. The value of wrapLabel may be ignored if enableSort is set to true. 
CurrencyInput top
Base type for all DetailView inputs which are bound to a value
Child elements: StandardMenuElement Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
exchangeRate Expression (Double)   An optional expression to return a number. If specified, the return value will be used to override the default exchange rate when calculating amount for the secondary MoneyComponent. Only meaningful, when the underlying MoneyComponent is linked to a secondary MoneyComponent with a different currency.

Normally, you do NOT want to specify this attribute, thus allow the widget to look up the proper exchange rate from the primary currency to the secondary currency. Use with caution. 

flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
maxChars Integer 0  The maximum number of characters allowed for an input field. 
numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
onChange statement   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
DataSeries top
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
categoryLabel Expression (String)   An expression which evaluates to the label of each category, as well as the name of the general category bucket in which to place this series entry. 
dataValues Expression (Object)   The expression for the values of this data. Must be an array, list, or query. For chart types (e.g. Dial) that represent a single value, this array should contain only one component. 
label Expression (String)   An expression for the label of the data series. For a Dial chart, specifies the units of the dial. 
percentComplete Expression (Double)   An expression that returns percentage complete (between 0 to 1). Only applicable when the value is a time period. 
rgb String   An optional Hex RGB value, e.g., "FF00FF". If specifed, it overwrites the default color for this data series. Only applicable when this data series is rendered with a single color. 
value Expression (Object)   An expression that maps the yValue in component type of the values. The component object is accessable via the values symbol, i.e value.getY(). The returned value must be a number, date or time period (i.e., an array containing the start date and end date, for Gantt chart type). 
xValue Expression (Object)   An expression that maps the xValue in component type of the values. The component object is accessable via the values symbol, i.e value.getX(). The returned value must be a number or date. 
DateCell top
A ListView cell with extra attributes for a Date field
Child elements: ColumnHeader StandardMenuElement ColumnFooter Reflect
Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>"
