    onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    optionIcon Expression (String)   An optional expression to specify an icon for each option. The option value is exposed as "VALUE". The result must be a valid image file. 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
    TypeKeyInput top
    An Input with extra attributes for a TypeKey field
    Child elements: StandardMenuElement Reflect
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
    align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
    boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
    boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    filter Expression (context-dependent)   Optional Gosu expression for filtering the value range of the widget. You can write this either as a boolean expression over a "VALUE" symbol (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.isOkValue(VALUE)"), or as a more complex expression that takes a "VALUES" array symbol and returns a List (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.filterValues(VALUES)") which is more powerful and efficient but harder to write. 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
    noneSelectedLabel Expression (String)   Label expression for the "none selected" option 
    numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    onChange statement   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
    onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    showNoneSelected Boolean true  Whether to show the "none selected" option. Default to true.
    Deprecated: If set to false, the value on the UI will be inconsistent from backing model value when the model value is null. DO NOT USE.
    Alternatively, you can set "required" to true, to prevent the user from selecting "none selected" option when the model value is already set. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueWidth positiveInteger   Optional pixel width for the dropdown control inside the cell. Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. You can set this attribute when some options of this dropdown are too long and you need to reduce the display width of the dropdown control. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
    TypeKeyRadioInput top
    A TypeKeyInput which renders as radio buttons. Only use this when you know that the typelist is limited to two or three options.
    Child elements: StandardMenuElement Reflect
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
    align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
    boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
    boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    filter Expression (context-dependent)   Optional Gosu expression for filtering the value range of the widget. You can write this either as a boolean expression over a "VALUE" symbol (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.isOkValue(VALUE)"), or as a more complex expression that takes a "VALUES" array symbol and returns a List (i.e. "Libraries.MyLib.filterValues(VALUES)") which is more powerful and efficient but harder to write. 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
    noneSelectedLabel Expression (String)   Label expression for the "none selected" option 
    numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    onChange statement   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
    onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    optionIcon Expression (String)   An optional expression to specify an icon for each option. The option value is exposed as "VALUE". The result must be a valid image file. 
    postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    showNoneSelected Boolean true  Whether to show the "none selected" option. Default to true.
    Deprecated: If set to false, the value on the UI will be inconsistent from backing model value when the model value is null. DO NOT USE.
    Alternatively, you can set "required" to true, to prevent the user from selecting "none selected" option when the model value is already set. 
    stacked Expression (Boolean)   If true, the radio buttons are stacked vertically. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueWidth positiveInteger   Optional pixel width for the dropdown control inside the cell. Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. You can set this attribute when some options of this dropdown are too long and you need to reduce the display width of the dropdown control. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
    UserCell top
    A Cell that includes a drop-down list of users related to the current user, and a menu containing Select User and Search User items. The locations to which those items navigate are specified by the searchLocation and selectionLocation attributes.
    Child elements: ColumnHeader StandardMenuElement ColumnFooter Reflect
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for details. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
    align WidgetAlignment   Specifies the alignment of this cell. Valid values: "left", "right", or "center". If no value is specified, the default alignment is determined by the value type ("center" for boolean values; "right" for numeric values; "left" for other value types). 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
    bold Boolean false  If true, renders the cell contents in bold text. Defaults to false. 
    colspan Integer   Like the HTML colspan attribute, lets this cell span across multiple columns of other rows. Useful for generating a "group header" row above a RowIterator. The default value is 1. A value greater than 1 is only allowed when the containing row is not iterated by a RowIterator. 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    enableSort Boolean true  If true, allows the user to sort the values in the column by clicking on the header 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    fontColor Expression (String)   An expression that returns a String containing the CSS color to be used for highlighting a column. If the expression returns null or "", no highlighting is done. If the expression returns "Normal", normal highlighting will be used. 
    footerLabel Expression (String)   An optional expression. If specified, a footer cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing Row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerSumValue" is specified. 
    footerSumFormat Expression (context-dependent)   An optional expression, if sepcified, will be used as format pattern for the footer sum value. Normally not specified, so that the "format" and\or "formatType" of the cell value will be applied to footer sum value. Only applicable when "footerSumValue" is specified. The result of this expression must conform to the number format defined in java.text.DecimalFormat. 
    footerSumValue Expression (context-dependent)   An optional Numeric expression. If specified, a footer cell that sums the specified value for all cells in this column will be rendered. Pagination of the list does not affect the sum value. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. Not allowed when "footerLabel" is specified. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    hasCheckBox Boolean false  If true, generates a checkbox at the beginning of this cell. This checkbox can be used to check this entry in the nearest containing Iterator. Defaults to false. Only allowed if this cell is inside a CellIterator or under a Row inside a RowIterator. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    icon Expression (context-dependent)   Refers to an image file. If defined, makes this an icon cell. The "value" attribute should be a boolean expression describing whether the icon is visible in a given row. 
    iconLabel Expression (String)   The ALT text for any icon generated in the content cells 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
    label Expression (Object)   An optional expression. If specified, a header cell with the specified value will be rendered for this column. Only applicable when the containing row is iterated by a RowIterator. 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the header. 
    numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    onChange Expression (void)   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
    onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
    postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
    printWidth String 1  Relative width when printing to PDF. All widths are relative to the widths of the other columns in the ListView 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    searchLocation String pcf.UserSearchPopup.push()  The location of the user search item as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].go()" 
    selectLocation String pcf.UserSelectPopup.push()  The location of the user select items as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].go()" 
    setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    showHeaderIcon Boolean true  If true, shows the icon defined by "icon" in the header cell for this column. The default value is true. 
    sortBy String   An optional comma-separated sequence of Expressions, each of which is assumed to be a dot-delimited path, the value by which this column will be sorted if the user clicks on the header cell. 
    sortDirection WidgetSortDirection ascending  Either "ascending" or "descending" 
    sortOrder Integer   The priority of sorting relative to other sorting elements like IteratorSort and Cell. The lower the number, the higher the priority. The highest priority is "1" 
    styleClass WidgetStyleClass   CSS style class for the cell content; for instance, "miniButton" makes a link appear as a small button 
    tooltip Expression (String)   Extra "alt" text to show when the user hovers the mouse over the header cell of this column. 
    unique Boolean false  If true, validate before commit that the value of this column is unique across all rows in the current page. Only meaningful when this column is editable. 
    updatefooterSumOnCellChange Boolean true  If true, the footer sum value of this column will be updated upon each cell value change. Default to true. Only applicable when the "footerSumValue" expression is identical to the "value" expression. You can set this flag to false to reduce server load and only calculate the updated sum value when the user clicks the "Get Sum" button or refreshes the page. 
    useHeaderStyle Boolean false  If true, renders this cell in header style. Defaults to false. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    validationLabel Expression (String)   The label of this cell to be used when it has validation issues. Not needed when this cell has a "label". Required if the cell is editable but does not have a "label". 
    value Expression (Object)   The value this element binds to. If the element is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    valueVisible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, hides the contents of the cell (its "ValueWidget"), but not the cell itself. Needed since hiding the actual cell usually screws up the layout 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    width String   The HTML width of the cell, either in pixels ("30") or percentage ("30%"). Usually you get best results by leaving this unspecified. This attribute does not affect size of the Textbox or Dropdwon when editing the field. Instead you can use "numCols" on TextCell to specify the size of the Textbox; or "valueWidth" on TypeKeyCell/RangeCell to specify the pixel width of the Dropdown. 
    wrap Boolean true  If true, allows text content to wrap. Defaults to true. 
    wrapLabel Boolean false  If true, allows the "label" to wrap. Defaults to false. The value of wrapLabel may be ignored if enableSort is set to true. 
    UserInput top
    An Input that includes a drop-down list of users related to the current user, and a menu containing Select User and Search User items. The locations to which those items navigate are specified by the searchLocation and selectionLocation attributes.
    Child elements: StandardMenuElement Reflect
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action statement   An optional action to take when the user clicks the value of this widget when the value is not being edited. See ActionBase for list of available action prefixes. When specified, the value of this widget will be rendered as a link when the value is not being edited. 
    actionAvailable Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression controlling whether the action should be available in this specific context when in read-only mode. This is ignored if in edit mode or if the action is null. This attribute will be deprecated in a future release, please use the 'available' attribute instead. To disable action in readonly mode, you can set available="CurrentLocation.InEditMode || <action-available-condition>" 
    align WidgetAlignment   Alignment of the widget ("left", "right", or "center") 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children 
    boldLabel Boolean false  If true then the label is displayed in bold text. 
    boldValue Boolean false  If true then the value is displayed in bold text when read-only. 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   The confirmation message to show when "showConfirmMessage" is set. If not specified, a standard message will be used. 
    conversionExpression Expression (context-dependent)   A Gosu expression used to convert the value picked from a popup before set it into the model value of this widget. The picked value will be exposed as a symbol with the name "PickedValue" 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    editable Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if false, makes this widget and all its children read-only 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    focusOnStartEditing Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if returns true, this widget will get focus when start editing the containing location. 
    formatType FormatType   How the value is formatted; options include "general", "currency", and "email". See the formatType enumeration. 
    helpText Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info that guides the user to edit this widget. The help info will show up if the user hovers the mouse over or focuses on the widget, when the widget is in edit mode. 
    hideChildrenIfReadOnly Boolean true  If false, menu items under this input will be shown even when the input is not editable. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    imeMode IMEMode   Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for this field, e.g. for East Asian locales. If not specified, the field will not change the state of the IME. If "active", the field will activate the IME on focus, and if "inactive", the field will deactivate the IME on focus. 
    inputConversion Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that converts the presentation value to a model value. The presentation value string is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    labelAbove Boolean false  If true then the label portion of the Input will be rendered above the value 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
    numCols Integer   The size of the text field, in characters (if the value is rendered as a text field) 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    onChange statement   Gosu expression to invoke when the value is changed by the user. Currently only supported for immediate-post-back. 
    onPick statement   Gosu expression to be executed after the value is set from a picker. 
    outputConversion Expression (String)   A Gosu expression that converts the model value to a presentation value. The model value is exposed to this expression as the symbol "VALUE". The return type of this expression must be String. 
    postOnChange Boolean false  If set to true, the new value is immediately posted back to the server when user changes the field value. 
    requestValidationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression used to validate user value before setting it to the model. This expression can access any symbols available to this widget, and a "VALUE" symbol that represents the user value. If this expression returns null, the user value will be set into the model. Otherwise, an error message containing the result of the expression will be displayed on the page, the value will not be set into the model, and no actions can be performed until the error is corrected. 
    required Expression (Boolean)   If true, then the cell must be filled out by the user 
    searchLocation Expression (Location) pcf.UserSearchPopup.push()  The location of the user search item as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].go()" 
    selectLocation Expression (Location) pcf.UserSelectPopup.push()  The location of the user select items as a Gosu expression of the form "[location name].go()" 
    setter statement   !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! * Deprecated. DO NOT USE. * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Consider using "onChange/onPick/inputConversion/outputConversion" where available. If specified and the Input is editable, then any new value of the Input is written to this expression (Gosu by default) instead of to "value". The new value is exposed as the symbol "VALUE". For instance if your value expression is "Foo.getSomething()" then it can't be written to since it's not an L-value; so you could specify a setter expression along the lines of "Foo.setSomething(VALUE)" Warning: if you use this attribute many pebbles features will not work, including but not limited to: * Correct automatic detection of the state of the updated data * Correct automatic detection of the editability of the data * Correct automatic detection of the maximum size of a text input 
    shortcut String   Optional keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. This is only applicable when this widget has an "action" specified and the value is not being edited. 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which determines whether or not to show a confirmation message when the field value is changed directly from the UI. It's NOT applicable when the value is changed indirectly, for example, as a result of client reflection. 
    validationExpression Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression to run before committing the record. This expression can refer to any symbols available to this widget. If this expression returns null, the validation is considered successful; otherwise, the result of this expression will be displayed as an error and the record will not be committed. 
    value Expression (Object)   The value this Input binds to as an Expression. If the Input is editable then this value is both read from and written to (unless "setter" is defined). 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   If used instead of "editable", specifies whether the Input is editable when data is being created 
    ValueAttributes top
    Subclasses: ValueCellType ValueInputType
    ValueCellType top
    Base type for all Cells that can be bound to a value.
    Subclasses: AddressBookContactCell Cell CheckBoxCell ClaimContactCell ClaimRelatedContactCell CurrencyCell DateCell DocumentIconCell FinancialsSumCell FinancialsSummaryLabelCell PickerCell PickerCellType RadioButtonCell RangeCellType TextCellType TypeKeyCell UserCell
    ValueInputType top
    Base type for all DetailView inputs which are bound to a value
    Subclasses: ActivitySubjectSearchInput AddressAutoFillTextInput AddressBookContactInput BooleanDropdownInput BooleanRadioInput CheckBoxInput ClaimContactInput CurrencyInput DateCriterionChoiceInput DateInput DocumentDetailsFileInput DocumentFilePathInput DocumentScript FinancialCriterionChoiceInput FinancialCriterionMultiCurrencyChoiceInput GroupInput HiddenInput Input PaymentRecurrenceInput PickerInput PolicyDescriptionInput PreFormattedTextInput RangeInputBase ReadOnlyDocumentScript TextInputType ToolbarInput TypeKeyInput UserInput
    Variable top
    Creates a new local variable with the same lifespan as the parent widget. This variable can be edited directly by value / input / cell widgets.
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    initialValue Expression (context-dependent)   The initial value of the Variable, specified as a Gosu expression. If not specified, the initial value will be null. 
    name String   The name by which the variable is exposed. The parent widget of this element and all its descendents will be able to refer to the symbol by this name. Note that Inputs and Cells can refer to "name" directly in their "value" expressions and even change the value of the variable. 
    recalculateOnRefresh Boolean false  If true, the value of the variable will be reset by calculating the initialValue expression, when the page is rerendered from the server. Default to false. 
    type Type reference   The type of the symbol, such as "String" or "Policy". Can be left off if initialValue is specified. 
    Verbatim top
    A handy widget for displaying static text on the UI
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (String)   Label to render. 
    labelStyleClass String   Custom extension CSS style class to apply to the label. 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children 
    warning Boolean false  If true, renders the message in a more visible "warning" style 
    WebMessageWorksheet top
    A special Worksheet to display runtime web messages. Do NOT modify.
    Child elements: Variable LocationEntryPoint Scope Code ScreenRef Screen
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    afterCancel statement   Gosu expression to run after the location is canceled. 
    afterCommit statement   Gosu expression to run after the location is updated. 
    afterReturnFromPopup statement   Gosu expression to run after return to this page from a popup. Whether the popup was committed is exposed as a symbol with the name "committed". 
    alwaysInEditMode Expression (Boolean)   If true the location will always go back to edit mode after a commit / cancel 
    beforeCancel statement   Gosu expressionto run when the location is canceled but before the rest of the cancel completes. 
    beforeCommit statement   Gosu expression to run before the location is updated but after the UI is validated. 
    beforeValidate statement   Gosu expression to run before the location is updated and before the UI is validated. 
    canEdit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, prevents the user from putting the location into edit mode 
    canVisit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, means the user has no permission to visit the location, and links to the location will be either invisible or grayed out, depending on context. 
    closeOnLeaveScope Boolean false  An optional attribute, if true, this worksheet will be closed when leave the worksheet scope. Only applicable if it has no unsaved work. Default to false, so that the worksheet becomes hidden when out of scope, and reappears automatically when enter the scope again. 
    countsAsWork Boolean true  If false, the location can still be kept in the autosave cache, but does not appear as unsaved work to the user (with link highlighting etc.). 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
    handlesValidationIssue Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if specified, determines whether validation issues on a particular entity should be fixed on this page. The entity instance with validation issues is exposed to this expression as "VALUE". For example, "VALUE typeis entity.MyBean". If not specified, validation issues on any entity that matches type of the "validationParameter" should be fixed on this page.
    This attribute is ignored if "validationParameter" is not defined. 
    id String   ID of this Location. Must be unique among all Locations. 
    onConcurrentDataChange statement   An optional Gosu expression to run after concurrent data change is detected. This expression typically displays unsaved local changes to the user. 
    parent Location reference   Reference to the "parent location" of this location, to specifiy the hierarchy of pcf locations. Used for the automatically generated "up link" in the title bar, highlighting of current menu links, and grouping items under "Unsaved Work". Usually the parent is the location right above this location in the application hierarchy, i.e. the parent of "ActivityDetailWorksheet" is "ClaimWorkplan", the parent of "Desktop Activities" is "Desktop" and "Desktop" has no parent at all. 
    showUpLink Boolean false  If true, creates an "up link" icon in the title bar that links to the parent location. The upLink will pop the current location off the stack if the parent location is in the stack; otherwise, the upLink will "go" to the parent location, passing all of the symbols from the current page in a manner consistent with the "go" action. 
    startEditing statement   Gosu expression to run when the location goes into edit mode. 
    startInEditMode Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, puts the location in edit mode as soon as the user enters it 
    tabLabel Expression (String)   The label for the tab of this Worksheet in the Workspace 
    title Expression (String)   The title of the location. The title is shown in the top title bar, unless the Screen uses a special TitleBar element to override it. 
    validateOnBundleCommit Boolean true  If false, the page will disable the automatic validation that happens on every commit. Only set this attribute to false if you're really sure you know what you're doing. 
    validationParameter String   The name of an argument on a LocationEntryPoint, used for fixing entity validation issues. 
    WidgetAlignment top
    Alignment of a widget
    Value: Description:
    left  
    center  
    right  
    WidgetBase top
    Subclasses: PanelDivider WidgetBaseOptionalID WidgetBaseRequireID
    WidgetBaseOptionalID top
    Base type for all Widgets (i.e. elements that can be seen on the UI)
    Subclasses: AddMenuItemIterator Calendar CardIterator CardViewPanel CellIterator ChartPanel Choice DetailViewPanel EditButtons HierarchicalActionSetType InfoBar InputColumnType InputDivider InputIterator InputSet InputSetRef IteratorButtons Label LinkIterator ListDetailPanel ListViewInput ListViewPanel LocationRefIterator MenuItemDivider MenuItemIterator MenuItemSetRef MenuItemTree MenuTree Messages PanelColumn PanelIterator PanelRef PanelRow PanelSet PrintOutButton RowIterator Row RowSet RowSetRef RowTree ScreenRef SearchPanel TitleBar ToolbarButtonSet ToolbarButtonSetRef ToolbarDivider ToolbarFilter TreeButtons TreeViewPanel Verbatim WizardButtons
    WidgetBaseRequireID top
    Base type for all Widgets that require an ID
    Subclasses: ActionBase AddActionType Card CellType InfoBarElement InputGroup InputType RemoveButton SearchItem TreeView
    WidgetSortDirection top
    Sorting direction: ascending or descending
    Value: Description:
    ascending Ascending order, as in "A", "B", "C" 
    descending Descending order, as in "C", "B", "A" 
    WidgetStyleClass top
    Style class of a widget
    Value: Description:
    none none 
    miniButton Makes a link look like a small button 
    bigButton Makes a link look like a normal button 
    stretch Makes the textbox width to be 100% 
    bold Makes the text bold for a Link element 
    archived Indicates that this widget is bound to an archived data object 
    WizardButtons top
    A set of pre-included toolbar buttons for Wizard control. Gets its set of buttons from its containing wizard
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    cancelShortcut String   Cancel keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    defaultButton DefaultButtonType next  This button is the default for the page, and will be "clicked" when the user presses Enter 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    finishShortcut String   Finish keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    id String   (Optional) reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    pickValue Expression (Object)   The value returned from this location when update is clicked 
    Wizard top
    A Location with multiple Screens
    Child elements: Variable LocationEntryPoint Code AbstractWizardStepsDef AbstractWizardButtons AbstractWizardStepsRef
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    acceleratedMenuActions Location reference   The ID of the AcceleratedMenuActions content for this location group. It will be inherited by all descendent Locations of this group by default. Normally not used, but use MenuActions instead. 
    afterCancel statement   Gosu expression to run after the Wizard is canceled. See ActionBase for kinds of available actions 
    afterFinish statement   Gosu expression to run after the user gets all the way through and finishes the Wizard. 
    afterReturnFromPopup statement   Gosu expression to run after return to this page from a popup. Whether the popup was committed is exposed as a symbol with the name "committed". 
    autosaveable Boolean true  If true, then the location will be saved in the auto-save cache when the user navigates out if (a) it is in edit mode, and (b) there is any unsaved data. The location is restored from the cache when the user returns to it 
    beforeCancel statement   Gosu expression to run when the Wizard is canceled but before the rest of the cancel completes. 
    beforeCommit statement   Gosu expression to run before the wizard state is persisted into database. 
    canEdit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, prevents the user from putting the location into edit mode 
    canVisit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, means the user has no permission to visit the location, and links to the location will be either invisible or grayed out, depending on context. 
    cancelWarning Expression (String)   Gosu expression that returns a message to display in a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to cancel this wizard 
    countsAsWork Boolean true  If false, the location can still be kept in the autosave cache, but does not appear as unsaved work to the user (with link highlighting etc.). 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
    finishConfirmation Expression (String)   If non-null, the string specified will be presented to the user as a confirmation message when they attempt to finish the wizard. 
    id String   ID of this Location. Must be unique among all Locations. 
    independentStepsTitle Expression (String)   The optional title for menu links of independent steps. 
    independentStepsTitleIcon Expression (String)   The optional title icon for menu links of independent steps. 
    infoBar Location reference   ID of the InfoBar content for this location (just below the TabBar and above the main content) 
    inheritMenuLinks Boolean false  If true, this wizard will have no MenuLinks of its own, and will inherit MenuLinks from its ancestor location group (if any). 
    menuActions Location reference   ID of the optional MenuActions content for this location (in the bottom of the left menu) 
    menuLinks Location reference   Normally NOT specified, in which case default MenuLinks (in the left menu) are generated based on steps of this wizard. 
    menuTree Location reference   ID of the optional MenuTree content for this location (in the left menu). This should only be used if the wizard is also overriding the menuLinks attribute 
    onConcurrentDataChange statement   An optional Gosu expression to run after concurrent data change is detected. This expression typically displays unsaved local changes to the user. 
    onResume statement   A Gosu expression to run when this location is resumed from the autosave cache. 
    parent Location reference   Reference to the "parent location" of this location, to specifiy the hierarchy of pcf locations. Used for the automatically generated "up link" in the title bar, highlighting of current menu links, and grouping items under "Unsaved Work". Usually the parent is the location right above this location in the application hierarchy, i.e. the parent of "ActivityDetailWorksheet" is "ClaimWorkplan", the parent of "Desktop Activities" is "Desktop" and "Desktop" has no parent at all. 
    showUpLink Boolean false  If true, creates an "up link" icon in the title bar that links to the parent location. The upLink will pop the current location off the stack if the parent location is in the stack; otherwise, the upLink will "go" to the parent location, passing all of the symbols from the current page in a manner consistent with the "go" action. 
    startInEditMode Expression (Boolean) true  Boolean expression which, if true, puts the location in edit mode as soon as the user enters it. Default to true for Wizard. 
    subtitle Expression (String)   The optional sub title for this wizard. If specified, it will be displayed in the left nav bar above links to wizard steps. 
    tabBar Location reference TabBar()  ID reference to the TabBar content for the location. Normally not specified since "TabBar" is the default. 
    title Expression (String)   The optional title for this wizard. If specified, it will be displayed in the left nav bar above links to wizard steps. 
    WizardStepBase top
    Base fields common to all WizardSteps
    Subclasses: QuickClaimStep WizardStep
    WizardStepGroup top
    Groups child Steps together, and provides a group label
    Child elements: Require AbstractWizardStepsDef AbstractWizardStepsRef
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    collapseIfNotCurrent Boolean false  If true, this group is collapsed in the left nav menu when none of its child steps is the currently selected step. Default to false. 
    id String   The reference ID of the group, which must be unique among all locations. 
    label Expression (String)   label for this widget 
    mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
    shortcut String   Optional Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. If specified, this will be used for the MenuLink generated for this WizardStepGroup. 
    visible Expression (Boolean) true  A boolean expression which indicates if this Step is visible at all in the Wizard 
    WizardStepGroupRef top
    Includes a globally-shared WizardStepGroup
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    def Location reference   ID of the group to include by reference 
    mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the path will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no path is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
    WizardStepIterator top
    Iterates over an array to create multiple steps in the wizard
    Child elements: AbstractWizardStepsRef
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    elementName String   As each element in the array result of "value" is displayed, it is exposed as a symbol with the name "elementName", which the contents of this iterator can refer to 
    type Type reference   Lets you manually specify the type of element exposed as "elementName". This is useful if you have special knowledge about the type of element returned by "value": for example, if the field referred to returns an array of Contacts but you happen to know that they are guaranteed to all be Persons 
    value Expression (Object)   A Gosu expression that evaluates to the elements over which to iterate. Must evaluate to an Object array or a IQueryBeanResult. 
    WizardStep top
    Defines one step in a Wizard.
    Child elements: NextCondition SkipButton
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    allowFinish Expression (Boolean)   Gosu expression indicating whether or not the finish button is available. If not specified, then the finish button will be available if this is the last step in the wizard. 
    allowNext Expression (Boolean)   Gosu expression indicating whether or not the next button is available. If not specified, then the next button will be available unless this is the last step in the wizard. 
    available Expression (Boolean) true  A boolean expression which, if false, grays the step out and won't let the user visit it (as opposed to visible/canVisit, which hide the step completely) 
    beforeSave statement   Gosu expression to execute before save this step. Only applicable when "save" returns true. 
    handlesValidationIssue Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if specified, determines whether validation issues on a particular entity should be fixed on this Step. The entity instance with validation issues is exposed to this expression as "VALUE". For example, "VALUE typeis entity.MyBean". 
    id String   The reference ID of the step, which must be unique among all locations. This ID is used for a lot of purposes; most importantly it is what you refer to in the "go" action 
    independent Boolean false  If true, the step is displayed at the bottom of the wizard, and is separated from ordinary wizard navigation; in particular, it is not affected by the high water mark. 
    label Expression (String)   The label for this step in the wizard menu links. If unspecified, the "title" attribute is used as the default. 
    mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the screen will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no screen is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
    onExit statement   Gosu expression to run when leaving this step to move forward in the wizard or when finishing on this step. 
    onFirstEnter statement   Gosu expression to execute when entering this step for the first time. 
    refreshStepsOnExit Boolean false  If true, refreshes the steps in the wizard when leaving this step. Should only be set to true on steps that allow the editing of some value that could affect a WizardStepIterator defined in this wizard 
    save Expression (Boolean) false  If true, a draft will be saved whenever we exit this step 
    screen Location reference   The ID of the Screen for this step. 
    shortcut String   Optional Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit. If specified, this will be used for the MenuLink generated for this WizardStep. 
    showNextIfLastStep Boolean false  If true, the next button will always be shown, regardless of whether or not the wizard thinks it has more steps. 
    title Expression (String)   The title for this step 
    visible Expression (Boolean) true  A boolean expression which indicates if this Step is visible at all in the Wizard 
    WizardStepSet top
    A group of wizard steps
    Child elements: Require AbstractWizardStepsDef AbstractWizardStepsRef
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    available Expression (Boolean) true  A boolean expression which, if false, grays the step out and won't let the user visit it (as opposed to visible/canVisit, which hide the step completely) 
    id String   The reference ID of the group, which must be unique among all locations. 
    mode String   An optional String which, if specified, means that any element dynamically including this widget must specify the same mode. There is also a special mode "default" you can use which means "Use this widget if no widget with the specified mode exists". You can also have this widget match more than one mode by separating mode strings with a | character. 
    visible Expression (Boolean) true  A boolean expression which indicates if this Step is visible at all in the Wizard 
    WizardStepSetRef top
    Includes a globally-shared wizard path by ID and, optionally, mode
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    def Location reference   ID of the group to include by reference 
    mode Expression (Object)   If defined, "mode" is evaluated and its result is converted to a String; the path will be loaded whose "mode" matches the evaluated "mode" of this element. If no path is found with a matching "mode", then the panel with mode="default" is used; if there is no default a runtime exception is thrown 
    Worksheet top
    A special Page that goes in the Workspace. A worksheet will only be visible when it's "in scope". Use the scope element to specify the scope of this worksheet.
    Child elements: Variable LocationEntryPoint Scope Code ScreenRef Screen
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    afterCancel statement   Gosu expression to run after the location is canceled. 
    afterCommit statement   Gosu expression to run after the location is updated. 
    afterReturnFromPopup statement   Gosu expression to run after return to this page from a popup. Whether the popup was committed is exposed as a symbol with the name "committed". 
    alwaysInEditMode Expression (Boolean)   If true the location will always go back to edit mode after a commit / cancel 
    beforeCancel statement   Gosu expressionto run when the location is canceled but before the rest of the cancel completes. 
    beforeCommit statement   Gosu expression to run before the location is updated but after the UI is validated. 
    beforeValidate statement   Gosu expression to run before the location is updated and before the UI is validated. 
    canEdit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, prevents the user from putting the location into edit mode 
    canVisit Expression (Boolean)   A boolean expression which, if false, means the user has no permission to visit the location, and links to the location will be either invisible or grayed out, depending on context. 
    closeOnLeaveScope Boolean false  An optional attribute, if true, this worksheet will be closed when leave the worksheet scope. Only applicable if it has no unsaved work. Default to false, so that the worksheet becomes hidden when out of scope, and reappears automatically when enter the scope again. 
    countsAsWork Boolean true  If false, the location can still be kept in the autosave cache, but does not appear as unsaved work to the user (with link highlighting etc.). 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to this element. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" or PCF editor, the description will show up there. 
    handlesValidationIssue Expression (Boolean)   An optional boolean expression, if specified, determines whether validation issues on a particular entity should be fixed on this page. The entity instance with validation issues is exposed to this expression as "VALUE". For example, "VALUE typeis entity.MyBean". If not specified, validation issues on any entity that matches type of the "validationParameter" should be fixed on this page.
    This attribute is ignored if "validationParameter" is not defined. 
    id String   ID of this Location. Must be unique among all Locations. 
    onConcurrentDataChange statement   An optional Gosu expression to run after concurrent data change is detected. This expression typically displays unsaved local changes to the user. 
    parent Location reference   Reference to the "parent location" of this location, to specifiy the hierarchy of pcf locations. Used for the automatically generated "up link" in the title bar, highlighting of current menu links, and grouping items under "Unsaved Work". Usually the parent is the location right above this location in the application hierarchy, i.e. the parent of "ActivityDetailWorksheet" is "ClaimWorkplan", the parent of "Desktop Activities" is "Desktop" and "Desktop" has no parent at all. 
    showUpLink Boolean false  If true, creates an "up link" icon in the title bar that links to the parent location. The upLink will pop the current location off the stack if the parent location is in the stack; otherwise, the upLink will "go" to the parent location, passing all of the symbols from the current page in a manner consistent with the "go" action. 
    startEditing statement   Gosu expression to run when the location goes into edit mode. 
    startInEditMode Expression (Boolean) false  Boolean expression which, if true, puts the location in edit mode as soon as the user enters it 
    tabLabel Expression (String)   The label for the tab of this Worksheet in the Workspace 
    title Expression (String)   The title of the location. The title is shown in the top title bar, unless the Screen uses a special TitleBar element to override it. 
    validateOnBundleCommit Boolean true  If false, the page will disable the automatic validation that happens on every commit. Only set this attribute to false if you're really sure you know what you're doing. 
    validationParameter String   The name of an argument on a LocationEntryPoint, used for fixing entity validation issues. 
    YesNoToolbarButton top
    Child elements: StandardMenuElement DetailViewPanel
    Attribute: Type: Default: Description:
    action statement   Action performed by this widget. By default, this is a Gosu expression. Other types of actions can be specified by using the following prefixes: http: causes the browser to follow the specified plain http link https: causes the browser to follow the specified plain https link javascript: causes the browser to execute the specified javascript logout: logs out of the application 
    available Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and all its children and makes them unclickable 
    confirmMessage Expression (String)   Confirmation message to show before performing the action 
    default Boolean false  If true, the button is the default for the page, and will be "clicked" when the user presses Enter 
    desc String   Use this to add your own comments to the widget. For now this attribute does nothing; later if we create a "UI dictionary" the description will show up there, much the way it does in the Data Dictionary. 
    download Boolean false  Should be true if the action taken by this widget is to download a file. 
    flags String   A very special expression defining what flags (see ToolbarFlag) must be checked for the toolbar button to be available (= not grayed out). All processing of flags happens on the browser-side. The flags syntax is a comma-separated list of predicates, and all predicates must be satisfied for the button to be available. Each predicate consists of a operator followed by a space and then the name of a ToolbarFlag. For instance, flags="one Foo, no Bar" means "only available if there is exactly one Foo checkbox checked and no Bar checkboxes checked". The available operators are: one, two, any, all, no, exists (same as any). 
    flatten Boolean false  If true, instead of showing a hierarchical menu, the widget will show a single menu with sub-menus grouped under headers. 
    hideIfEditable Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is editable. 
    hideIfReadOnly Boolean false  If true, makes the widget invisible if it is not editable. 
    icon Expression (context-dependent)   The icon to display in addition to the button label. 
    id String   Reference ID of the widget. This does not have to be globally unique; it only has to be unique among the widget's siblings 
    label Expression (Object)   Label to render. 
    numEntriesPerColumn Integer   The number of child MenuItems to show in each column. If not specified, all children will be shown in a single column. 
    promptDefault Expression (String)   Default text answer to the prompt message 
    promptQuestion Expression (String)   Question to ask the user before performing the action. The answser is exposed to the action as "web.WebUtil.ActionEventParameter". 
    retainScrollPosition Boolean false  If true, the page will scroll back to the original scroll position after the action. Should only be set if the action stays on the same page and the page layout does not change. Default to false 
    shortcut String   Keyboard shortcut character in the form of "Q" or "ShiftQ"; the "Alt" key is implicit 
    showConfirmMessage Expression (Boolean) true  Gosu expression which determines whether or not the confirmation message should be shown 
    subMenuOnDemand Boolean false  An optional attribute, if set, defer sub menu generation until user tries to open the menu. DO NOT set this flag unless the sub menu of this widget is very expensive to generate. Setting this flag will reduce time to load the page, however require fetching additional info from server in the background, when the menu gets opened for the first time after page loaded. 
    tooltip Expression (String)   A Gosu expression which, if defined, is evaluated to create help info if the user hovers the mouse over the button 
    visible Expression (Boolean)   Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and all its children
